title: Elizabeth Hurley, 54, looks unrecognisable as she transforms into Kill Bill's The Bride
text:
She is the age-defying actress who is known for her daring outfits.

And Elizabeth Hurley looked unrecognisable as she transformed into Kill Bill's 'The Bride' for a Halloween party on Saturday.

The actress, 54, showcased her incredible figure in a plunging bright yellow jumpsuit as worn by the nameless assassin played by Uma Thurman in the 2003 and 2004 Quentin Tarantino films.

Wow: Elizabeth Hurley looked unrecognisable as she transformed into Kill Bill's 'The Bride' for a Halloween party on Saturday

Spitting image: The actress, 54, showcased her incredible figure in a plunging bright yellow jumpsuit as worn by the nameless assassin played by Uma Thurman in the 2003 and 2004 Quentin Tarantino films (R)

The clinging garment cinched in at her slender waist and showed off her ample cleavage as she posed up a storm with a Samurai sword.

The star also showed off her lean legs as she struck a fierce pose in a caramel wig, with smoky shadow enhancing her pretty features.

Liz showed she was getting into the Halloween spirit as she captioned the photo with pumpkin emojis.

In Kill Bill Volume 1, The Bride dons the tracksuit when she jets to Japan to take on O-Ren Ishii - a member of the Deadly Vipers Assassination Squad - who betrayed her and left her for dead.

Scary: The clinging garment cinched in at her slender waist and showed off her ample cleavage as she posed up a storm with a Samurai sword

Wow: Liz showed she was getting into the Halloween spirit as she captioned the photo with pumpkin emojis

The Bride takes on O-Ren and her personal bodyguards, the Crazy 88, massacring them all with her sword.

As well as being a busy actress and swimwear designer, Elizabeth is also a campaigner for breast cancer awareness.

During her This Morning appearance, Model Liz bravely told hosts Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield: 'I’ve been working to raise awareness for breast cancer for 25 years.

Appearing on This Morning earlier this month, she explained that she lost her grandmother to the disease, reasoning: 'At that time, nobody spoke about breast cancer.'

The Austin Powers star previously revealed her relative showed her scars from a double mastectomy once she finally told her family about her diagnosis, but would often change the subject.

Glow: The star also struck a fierce pose in a caramel wig, with smoky shadow enhancing her pretty features.

Reflecting on when breast cancer was a taboo subject, the Royals actress explained: 'When I started working for the breast cancer campaign, my grandmother had just died.

'When I was told it was started because women were dying, it really rang home for me, because she didn’t talk about it. There was no awareness, no pink ribbon campaign.'

During her work as a global ambassador for the Estee Lauder Companies' Breast Cancer Awareness Campaign, Liz has insisted she's witnessed 'great changes' in research and attitudes towards the disease.
